item.title: The SEA designs Small Cells for NEC and the World
item.description:
The Sea is proud to announce the launch of a range of designs for residential and office small cells for NEC worldwide.

The SEA Managing director, Paul Phillips, says
“Unlike most products of this type our design is a simple, organic, asymmetrical form. As well as creating a tactile and beautiful looking object, the design is practical, dealing with the potential mess of cables by obscuring the connections beneath the smooth bowl-shaped top cover.

This distinctive family of products have a shape, size and finish enabling the technology to be delivered whilst respecting both domestic and office interior environments.

The innovative outer casing helps to cool the internal components, with the overlapping top cover providing a hidden continuous vent around the unit. This complements the highly energy efficient power consumption (over 50% lower than EU regulations).

The design provides a flexible solution to enable clear operator branding to be applied in line with NEC’s customers’ marketing and brand requirements.

Small cells - mini mobile base stations that connect via broadband - are already more abundant than 3G masts and will become present in more and more places as mobile communications devices use more data. They will be the way network operators ensure they can provide services in the buildings where their customers are.”

Anil Kohli, General Manager at NEC Europe, says
“The design of our new small cells by The SEA gives us a modern and distinctive look and feel for the range of hardware to support our suite of propositions to our global customers. They have already given us great feedback and we look forward to seeing them successfully deployed in homes and businesses around the world.”

The design also features:- Simple plug and play operation. Casing made from recycled plastic. Single solution for all bands including GPS antenna.

item.title: Public Services by Design
item.description:
Paul is working with the Design Council as a Design Associate to help redesign the pharmacy and its services at Whittingdon Hospital in north London.

Helping to transform public services through expert mentoring. The programme helps service leaders and frontline teams meet service delivery challenges.
Design Associates are strategic design advisors with experience of mentoring in both
the public and private sector. They will help you use design to ensure priority services are more effective and efficient and meet the needs of local people. Read More

item.title: SPARK™. The SPA in the Park - Coming Soon.
item.description:
SPARK™. The Spa in the Park. Inclusive, accessible and affordable luxury in the most amazing location in central London. Supporting and promoting the wellbeing and health of the people of London and its visitors.

We’ve been shortlisted for our new idea to build a new and inclusive Spa in London’s Regent Park. An amazing location for a Spa experience in a great city.

Keep an eye out for more news and developments.

Get in touch if you want to help in any way.

item.title: The SEA designing products for NEC.
item.description:
The SEA are designing a range of Femtocells for NEC.

These small pieces of hardware help you to get the best from your mobile when you are at home or work or out and about. They connect to the internet and deliver all your calls and internet connection on your own private 3G network. Saving you battery power over Wifi and delivering a whole new range of services between you and your family or colleagues.

The SEA’s new designs will help create a quality brand positioning for NEC in this market place and support their global mobile network customers.

Watch out for more news and to get a sneak preview of the final designs too.

item.title: In development - Latest thoughts from The SEA
item.description: Book Margins - Thoughts on scribbles in the margins for the digital age. Read more

item.title: Creation of a 21st Century Patent - Gold Ward IPA Effectiveness for Orange International
item.description: Thought it worth uploading this paper we put together with the team from WCRS - our advertising agency at the time. We won the first ever gold award for International Marketing with this paper. It describes the Orange business strategy as well as the Orange launches in the UK (briefly), and those whom I directed and led in Hong Kong, Israel, Switzerland, Belgium, Australia and India. The final section of the paper sets out to quantify shareholder value. Also the Mannesmann acquisition of Orange and the takeover of Mannesmann by Vodafone are explained and can be found here: - Orange - IPA case study 2000.pdf

item.title: Business Class Act
item.description:
Helping Grant Thornton position and market the latest UK government solutions for business programme for SME's in London.

Understanding Finance for Business is a programme designed to give London businesses the best possible chance of raising finance so they can reach their growth ambitions.

We designed a range of marketing materials and tools for use by the consortium to both recruit and market the scheme as well as materials for the sessions that companies are taken through on the scheme itself.
